Reviews.Title: Unit was defective and not useable with Linux OS
Reviews.Author: ProFss
Reviews.Content: I ordered this unit to record and view my security cameras over my network. It looked like a good price and arrived quickly. After setting the unit up it rebooted over and over every 4 to 5 minutes. Even worse for me it's network access is through Microsoft Windows Internet Explorer only. No access from Linux or Mac.

Reviews.Title: Linux-hostile device
Reviews.Author: Mark W Butler
Reviews.Content: Interface requires ActiveX, which Microsoft itself warns against.  Won't work with Linux.  Nobody should be using this.  Find an alternative.

Reviews.Title: 2nd dvr from these guys that has died within months & they refuse to replace. I install may systems for a living.
Reviews.Author: Cyberlinxz
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd dvr i have bought from the same people in 2 years that has failed.the first one totally died and they would not replace it now this one a newer better version has 3 channels that constantly stop working for hours or days at a time this is ridiculous and i am highly displeased! no one should ever buy one of these.i have installed several systems over the years and these are great at first but they die within months of use.save your self the money and buy something better...dont bother trying to get a replacement because they dont care about the customer and will re-fuse to do so.

Reviews.Title: Power supply inadequate
Reviews.Author: Techpro
Reviews.Content: I replaced a 4 channel system that had crashed the hard drive with this unit.  After 1 year (almost exactly) the external power supply on this unit failed and trashed the hard drive and the 12 volt circuit in the DVR.  The video and network interface still works.  The 12 v switcher power supplies seem to be problematic.  I've had 2 cameras that have had the 1 amp plug in power supplies fail along with taking out the LED lights.

Reviews.Title: if you don't need remote viewing other then IE then this is the one you want, all other should pass...
Reviews.Author: bgoff_ak
Reviews.Content: I have another 4 camera system that this was replacing. So I figured this would be a simple swap hard drive, reformat and set router ports ... Turns out I was in for hours of no help tech support ( my indian is getting much better though ) to find out that the web interface only works with Internet Explorer. That means all you that use Chrome or Safari are out of luck ( or your favorite *nix ). figuring that there was an apple app for the cameras and I all ready had one this would not be a problem.  turns out they use a differing protocol so my old camera app was not supported, should not be an issue they have an app for this product ( seems that the techs tell you that theirs does not work and you should use another one that well didn't work... for remote viewing from any thing other then IE this thing would be -1 stars, but seeing this does power up and you can use the VGA or BNC/TV out for a office or home that does not require remote viewing  id say a solid two... ( more so because it has not caught fire yet ) also to note with the non-standard items you would assume that the battery would be a standard 2032 coin battery, used in every appliance one could imagine but this uses a CR1220 battery. Lastly this thing has a pizzo buzzer on it that was remanufactured from those personal 120db security sirens, and its not afraid of using it for every error one could imagine and there is not a check box for disable stupid repeaded 1/2 second beep beep beep beep... ( nothing a soldering iron/ shoe goo and or hammer is not capable of fixing depending on your personal skills with the aforementioned items.

Reviews.Title: was looking for an 8 channel dvr i had a 4 channel dvr but need more channel so here i am thank alway looking for a great deal.
Reviews.Author: doc dre
Reviews.Content: show the perfect clear picture the price was just right the remote could have been better but i can live with that.

Reviews.Title: Needs faster search only goes to 16x
Reviews.Author: J J
Reviews.Content: Other DVR I use goes to 32x and this one only goes upto 16x so makes it a pain to browse video history.  But other than that has worked fine.  Installed a 500gb harddrive and so far only been recording 2 cameras since the 11th and no glitches yet.  Also have not got it online yet so no feedback available for network usage,  did download the app for my phone and it looks simple enough.

Reviews.Title: Works great. Very affordable.
Reviews.Author: Gorges
Reviews.Content: I like the capability to see the video on my android. After 6 months my hard drive died on me. This was one of my old ones I threw in this, it didn't come with it. The crazy part is if the drive is dead, the nic card stops working, and the vga port stops working. This can be very misleading. If this happens to you, just replace the hard drive and it will come to life again.

Reviews.Title: Zmodo software kills this product
Reviews.Author: Level1
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a cheap DVR, by all means get this product.The software is NOT standard, you will have to learn where everything is located to make changes between similar models all over again and again.Circuit boards are cheaply made and not one full board, but 2 separate ones joined by a connector or pins.If you are looking for a better quality camera system that is not blurry (even with 700TVL camera) go with a NVR system with ip cameras (1.3 to 5 MP).

Reviews.Title: Good device.
Reviews.Author: Steven Bremer
Reviews.Content: It's inexpensive and works very well. I bought it to replace a Q-See recorder that stopped working. I also bought the 1 T external hard drive that was suggested with this product because it does not come with storage. The hard drive was easy to hook up too. You can format the hard drive within the reocrder's software once it's installed.

Reviews.Title: Replaced older 8 channel Zmodo DVR
Reviews.Author: Michael Hoten
Reviews.Content: The DVR works well. The menu system is completely different than the other Zmodo DVR I had. Some parts are better, some are not. The computer software is a little quirky at times, but mostly gets the job done. If you're just viewing the cameras live and not trying to replay something it works pretty well. Replaying and downloading on the computer is troublesome. For example, if replaying two cameras at once, their times are not synced. The time you're watching on camera one may be at 8:00 AM, but the time on camera two may be 8:15 AM. Makes it rather difficult when trying to watch someone going from one camera's view to the next. I haven't tried the same thing doing it straight off the DVR, so that may work better. Overall I am pleased with the DVR. Hopefully it will last longer than the other one, which was just a bit less than 2 years.

Reviews.Title: Great item, like me.
Reviews.Author: Mike "Mike"
Reviews.Content: It's very nice... I see you...walking your dog up to my fence....are you gonna pick that up?  NO!  I print pic and mail it to local newspaper!  Gotcha!

Reviews.Title: Not so great.
Reviews.Author: T. Hollingsworth
Reviews.Content: Channel 2 does not work at all. I am only using 4 cameras so I do not need that channel and figure it would be more hassle than it is worth to return the item. Also, the manual is horrible. I am not a computer novice but configuring this thing to work so I can view my system over the internet when I am out of town is impossible unless you are an IT expert. It should be written like networking for dummies so those who are novices can use it without problems. I will have to try to research on the internet and see if I can get some help to set this up....what a pain. Most of the menus I have had to figure out by experimentation too as the manual is so bad. The print in the manual is too small too. I also wish it had front panel controls.

Reviews.Title: OK, but expect 1 year usage
Reviews.Author: Richard Costello
Reviews.Content: my unit worked fine for 1year and 2 weeks amazing how they engineer to not work 2 weeks after warranty expires.

Reviews.Title: HORRIBLE
Reviews.Author: Samuel Cintron
Reviews.Content: NOTHING worked.  By nothing I mean the DVR functioned and recorded however all the supporting software on my PC and/or Mobile wouldn't work.  I've setup a few different DVRs before and never had a more frustrating time than I did with this unit.  I returned it and went with KGUARD, couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this produced
Reviews.Author: dane myers
Reviews.Content: the customer support sucks i have had this dvr since July 31 2013 and been asking for help to set my dvr up to record through the cpu but no help or no support please don't us this produce

Reviews.Title: Too much AM Radio Interference
Reviews.Author: SourGrass "SourGrass"
Reviews.Content: In general, this DVR is good as advertised. I could view all cameras from internet. Only problem I got is the AM Radio Interference although my radio and DVR are more than 50ft apart. Most of AM stations could not be heard but noise.

Reviews.Title: DVR is awesome
Reviews.Author: Efrain Dominguez "EAD"
Reviews.Content: A bit lacking on the instructions and the o/s could use some more clarification on certain screens (email mainly).  I am able to receive image captures from the unit at work, will eventually run 4 cameras.  Would purchase again.

Reviews.Title: all I can say is just get it

Reviews.Content: device had a simple setup. up and online within minutes.. only complaint is that the website for support had very little information for into the device. also the center of reporting that they give you are for Windows XP they have no windows 8 support

Reviews.Title: pretty good system
Reviews.Author: daniel j hawkins
Reviews.Content: it looks pretty good so far. i have only had it hooked up for a day but if it keeps ticking like it is now i will be very very pleased with the product. i have had trouble in the past with similar products not lasting but mere months but hopefully this will do the job and work for at least 3 years for me. it has a lot of features i found surprising and at this time i am very happy with this product. as soon as i get my pan and tilt cameras in and hook them up i will know if that feature works correctly. looking forward to testing that out.

Reviews.Title: Zmodo not easy
Reviews.Author: Hicoteo
Reviews.Content: If this is your first DVR and you plan to do it yourself be prepared for a real learning experience.The basic physical installation of running wires, setting up the cameras and putting the DVR in a convenient location for viewing takes time and planning but in some ways that is the easy part. The hard part is programming it to view the cameras on the web, smart phones etc.The manual is useless and the Zmodo web site looks nice but lacks basic but vital information. It has a nice tutorial on how to get connected to the Internet but it leaves you hanging if you have a "dynamic IP address." If you don't know what I'm talking about you'll just have to figure it out like I did! Basically, I can see my cams from a computer using the same router as my DVR but not from an external computer over the internet because my internet IP address changes like most peoples’. They offer some free service to get around this. I signed up but there is no explanation on how to get it working so I'm stuck.The DVR has lots of settings but there is no information to tell you what each one is for. If there was, it might be possible to figure out a lot of things.The DVR itself is OK but I expected the saved videos to have better resolution. You can adjust the quality but even the best quality is not very good. The image during playback is very small and if you enlarge it, it is very grainy. To compensate for this you need very good quality cameras, which cost money. I thought I was buying good cameras but they ended up being the blurry ones everyone talks about. The resolution is so poor I have difficulty recognizing people I know never mind a stranger.The built in program is a bit quirky. Its different when accessed through the DVR then through a computer. So, in a way you have to learn to do everything two ways. Some things are easier to do from a computer and others are easier from the DVR. Some things I can’t get to work. The DVR also comes with another program but I can’t get it to work on my computer with Windows 7.Its all a very long and tiring learning process due to the lack of organized information. Perhaps over time I will get it all figured out. But, I think I will need a tech to set it up to its full potential.For the price this DVR does the job but the lack of information and instructions make setting it up very time consuming for the average Joe. I’m astonished that companies have the nerve to sell a product without providing detailed info to their customers.I use this DVR for apartment block surveillance. So far I haven’t caught any thieves but thanks to this system I did discover who barfed in the parking lot after drinking too much. Check out the video.

Reviews.Title: Good product; horrible documentation
Reviews.Author: RJM
Reviews.Content: After I finally got it working it is a great product.The documentation is very poor.  A few hours invested by the vendor or manufacture on documenting and screen shots would make this a five star product.  Also very little or no help on the internet.  I could have written a good manual in the time it took me to set it up.The existing document is also poorly printed with small font and crowded.  A few more pages might add a few cents to the production cost but might also triple sales.If you are not computer and network savvy I would not recommend this product at all.  If you know your way around networks fairly well and have patience, it is quite a deal.

Reviews.Content: to close on recorder for fat fingers to atach and remove.  play back very blotchy.  nite more than day.joe

Reviews.Title: Zmodo is the best!!!!

Reviews.Content: Their customer support is second to none. I had an older model which ran for 2 years straight with no problems.The cost is easy to absorb for the quality of product,and their customer service helpline is the best. Great product and great job!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Worst Dvr Don't Buy
Reviews.Author: Prasoon Dhungana
Reviews.Content: As soon as I go the system going, after installing the hard drive, I though the quality was excellent but after about an hour, the pictures started being blurry and became very static almost unrecognizable images and moving very fast. So, I decided to return the product. My suggestion, pay little extra for something like Lorex Edge or Samsung. My last Lorex lasted me more that 3 years with out any problem. SO, DON'T BUY. Sorry Zmodo..
